jobs_results.title: Software Engineer, iOS
jobs_results.description:
Who we are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we‚Äôre here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom ‚Äî for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want ‚Äî with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 4 million customers, making us one of Europe‚Äôs safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people. It‚Äôs these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!
Your Mission

As an iOS Developer on our Trading Experience team, you‚Äôll play a key role in building and enhancing our broker app to deliver a top-tier trading experience. Positioned at the heart of the product, our team is responsible for extending and maintaining the service catalog, enabling users to have seamless access to trading and cryptocurrency markets.

What You‚Äôll Do

‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain advanced features for the iOS platform, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver a smooth, user-centric trading experience.
‚Ä¢ Ensure code quality through extensive testing to meet functional requirements and uphold our quality standards.
‚Ä¢ Own and enhance your area of the app by addressing bugs, monitoring and optimizing performance, and implementing improvements to trading functionalities.
‚Ä¢ Stay updated on development trends, integrating new techniques and tools to continuously refine the app.

Who You Are

‚Ä¢ Passionate about mobile platforms and skilled at translating complex requirements into a streamlined, user-friendly trading experience.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in Swift with strong knowledge of iOS best practices, software architecture patterns, UIKit, and SwiftUI.
‚Ä¢ Experienced in building, testing, and refining mobile applications, with a proven track record.
‚Ä¢ Strong UI/UX & design orientation
‚Ä¢ Takes ownership of your work, proactively enhancing and adding value beyond initial requirements.

What‚Äôs in it for you

‚Ä¢ We're proud of our flexible working model that includes 2 days (minimum) working from the local Hub, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually
‚Ä¢ Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan
‚Ä¢ Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy
‚Ä¢ Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda
‚Ä¢ Company-wide and team events ‚Äî both in-person and virtually!
‚Ä¢ Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand

And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer - Development (ODS)
jobs_results.description:
iOS Developer - Development (ODS)

Country: Spain

Open Digital Services is a tech company with a unique culture, dedicated to creating innovative products for Santander Group Affiliates. Open Digital Services is part of the Retail & Commercial Division of Santander Group, one of the world's largest financial institutions and the Eurozone's leader, we're committed to being the best Digital Bank with Branches in the industry.

Our mission at ODS is to design and support an advanced digital and omnichannel platform, ensuring the best customer experience using cutting-edge technology. Openbank, our flagship partner, is where we develop our most advanced concepts. Be part of our Best-in-Class tech team and help us create unique value for our customers!

Join us to tackle exciting tech challenges in an agile environment, benefiting from learning, growth, and local and international career opportunities in a modern, diverse setting.

Mission and responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ We want to take our customers' digital experience to a new level and you will help us innovate in digital product development in banking.
‚Ä¢ Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ You will be responsible for iOS developments, helping to add value to Openbank Apps, as part of a multidisciplinary team of professionals.
‚Ä¢ You will bring your knowledge and experience to the team, proposing ideas for continuous improvement.
‚Ä¢ You will participate in code review and contribute to improve common practices.
‚Ä¢ You will be responsible for your own proofs of concept to add value to the product.

To be successful in the role you must have
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.
‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience in software development.
‚Ä¢ Experience in iOS App development.
‚Ä¢ Programming skills in Swift 5.
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of software architecture and clean architectures.
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of frameworks for mobile.
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of mobile application performance optimization.
‚Ä¢ Experience with REST integrations.
‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of development patterns.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with design teams to optimize the final customer experience.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of agile methodology, Scrum and Kanban.
‚Ä¢ Ability to learn quickly, creativity and initiative.
‚Ä¢ Ability to make autonomous decisions.
‚Ä¢ Results oriented.
‚Ä¢ Team player.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Immediate incorporation to a dynamic and agile company with a growth and expansion project.
‚Ä¢ Working in start-up mode with the support of Grupo Santander.
‚Ä¢ Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
‚Ä¢ Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
‚Ä¢ Collaboration in international projects and possibility of contact with different countries.Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.

Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here. [ URL ]

jobs_results.title: (Senior) iOS Developer - Remote
Computer Scientist (m/f/d) as App Developer for iOS / Android
jobs_results.description:
Computer Scientist (m/f/d) as App Developer for iOS / Android
RIWA - All geoinformation becomes a digital experience

RIWA GmbH is a leading company in the field of geoinformation and municipal specialist processes with over 25 years of experience and market leader in Bavaria. Our team develops innovative solutions for the digital transformation of cities and municipalities, in particular through geographic information systems (GIS). We also create digital twins of municipalities for construction planning, energy management and sustainable urban development. We offer customized solutions and attach great importance to close cooperation.

Become part of our team in one of our branches in Augsburg, Memmingen or Kempten im Allg√É¬§u. After training, you can also work from home.
These are your tasks
‚Ä¢ Further development of our native RIWA GIS Android app
‚Ä¢ Implementation of our previous apps for Apple iOS with Kotlin & Compose Multiplatform
‚Ä¢ Quality assurance through code reviews, unit tests and automated test procedures
‚Ä¢ Technical conceptualization of functional requirements from product management
‚Ä¢ Advising product management on development issues
You know your way around this
‚Ä¢ Completed studies in computer science or equivalent training
‚Ä¢ Sound knowledge in the development of Android apps (Kotlin, Java, Android SDK). Basic knowledge of iOS development advantageous (Swift)
‚Ä¢ Ideally experience with Jetpack Compose, Kotlin Multiplatform and Compose Multiplatform
‚Ä¢ Expertise with automated tests, CI/CD processes and agile software development
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of designing appealing user interfaces is a plus
‚Ä¢ Independent working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of self-motivation
What we offer you
‚Ä¢ A great team - #GernePerDu - and a varied job in the office and home office
‚Ä¢ Attractive salary, 13 monthly salaries, capital-forming benefits and a performance bonus
‚Ä¢ Family-friendly working time models with flexible working hours (flexitime)
‚Ä¢ Corporate benefits such as a job bike, drinks flat rate or employee discounts with over 1,500 providers
‚Ä¢ Intensive training in the field of activity and regular further training
‚Ä¢ An exciting environment with varied tasks
‚Ä¢ A secure, modern workplace close to the city center with future prospects
Have we piqued your interest?

Please send us your complete application documents directly online via our applicant management system, stating your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date.
RIWA GmbH

An der Neum√É¬ºhle 5, 87700 Memmingen
Everyone is welcome at RIWA. Diversity and equal opportunities are an integral part of our company. We see the uniqueness of each individual, and therefore the diversity of our teams, as the driving force behind our daily work and innovations. - We look forward to meeting you.

jobs_results.title: iOS developer
jobs_results.description:
Work with us
What do our employees value most?

It‚Äôs unanimous: We have a positive working environment. And what do our clients value most? Positive results. And this doesn‚Äôt just happen by chance. At O2O, we are convinced that a happy company is a company with a future. We can only achieve our goals by sharing a common aim. And, we aim high!

We believe that every member of the O2O team helps guide us in the right direction. Joint efforts, our curiosity and desire to innovate, research, learn and share have ensured we achieve this goal.

Our team is extremely talented. Professionals who value team spirit and responsibility. We‚Äôre committed to all-round success: success for our clients, for us and for society as a whole. We give back to society by collaborating with several foundations through recurring actions and volunteer plans. It‚Äôs how we give back and gain a broader and more realistic vision of our world.

If this mindset suits you and you would like to work with big and interesting clients, and if you ‚Äòre responsible and work well in a team, we‚Äôd like to meet you.

We are looking for an iOS developer (Native). Our goal is TDD development and we employ Continuous Integration (Jenkins).

Our new developments use Swift (from January 2016) and we offer maintenance/evolution in Objective-C for previously created projects.

New members of the team will be interested in learning and contributing knowledge and strive to make improvements day after day. Plus, we value people who are not shy of asking questions and are cheerful and honest.

We‚Äôre looking for the following:
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years‚Äô experience with native projects, either with Objective-C or Swift (we‚Äôve all learned these programs).
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of GIT (we use Git-flow as methodology).
‚Ä¢ Xcode.
‚Ä¢ Design patterns (MVP).
‚Ä¢ In sum: TDD, clean code, knowledge of low-level languages, GitHub account with FOSS‚Ä¶
